scenarioDescription:
The WD 1856+534 Exoplanetary System


Overview

WD 1856+534 is a star with 0.52 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.01 times its radius. It is located 80.68 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 7.93 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

WD 1856+534 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the WD 1856+534 system


WD 1856+534 b

WD 1856+534 b was discovered by the Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite (TESS) observatory, in 2020-09, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.02 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of WD 1856+534 b is 4388.400 times the mass of Earth. The radius of WD 1856+534 b is 10.400 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, WD 1856+534 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanetary system WD 1856+534, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite (TESS).
name: WD 1856+534 b - Gas Giant Orbiting a White Dwarf
